tn.text: This is Joshua's father. (See [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place on the east side of the Jordan River. It means "Acacia Trees." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These men were to visit the land to gain information on how Israel should conquer the land.
Rahab the prostitute protects the two Israelite spies from harm.

tn.ref: But the woman had taken the two men and hidden them
tn.text: This happened before the king's messenger spoke to her.
This refers to Rahab, the prostitute.
This is the time that day begins to change to the darkness of night.

tn.ref: But she had taken them ... on the roof
tn.text: This is background information and explains how she had hidden the men in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:02:04|2:4]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])
The roof was flat and strong, so people could walk around on it.
a plant that is grown for its fibers, which is used in making cloth
The men pursued the spies because of what Rahab had told them in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:02:04|2:5]].
places where a river or other body of water is shallow enough for people to get to the other side by walking through it
This refers to going to sleep for the night. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: I know that Yahweh has given you the land
tn.text: The word "you" refers to the all the Israelite people. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_youdual]])

tn.ref: fear of you has come upon us
tn.text: "fear can be expressed differently. AT: "we are afraid of you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

This compares the fearful people to ice melting and flowing away. Possible meanings are 1) they will be weak in the Israelites' presence or 2) they will be scattered. AT: "will be so afraid that they will not resist you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Rahab continues to talk to the Israelite spies.
This is another name for the Red Sea.
These are the names of the Amorite kings. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: our hearts melted and there was no courage left in anyone
tn.text: These two phrases share similar meanings, combined for emphasis. The phrase "our hearts melted" compares the hearts of the fearful people of Jericho to ice melting and flowing away. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
Rahab continues to talk to the Israelite spies.

tn.ref: please swear to me ... Give me a sure sign
tn.text: These are similar statements of Rahab seeking assurance from the spies. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: I have been kind to you
tn.text: The word "you" refers to the two spies. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_youdual]])

tn.ref: spare the lives ... save us from death
tn.text: a polite way of saying "do not to kill us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
The Israelite spies make the promise which Rahab asked for in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:02:12|2:12]]

tn.ref: Our life for yours, even to death
tn.text: This idiom is a way of swearing and asking God to curse them if they do not keep their promise. AT: "If we do not do what we promise, may Yahweh cause us to die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
The Israelite spies continue to talk to Rahab.

tn.ref: if you do not do this
tn.text: This expresses a condition for the promise the spies had made to Rahab. The word, "this," refers to "tie this scarlet rope in the window" in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:02:18|2:18]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
The Israelite spies clarify the condition they expressed in [[:en:bible:notes:jos:02:15|2:15]].
The Israelite spies continue talking to Rahab.

tn.ref: Whoever goes out of the doors of your house
tn.text: This phrase expresses a condition, creating a hypothetical situation. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: blood will be upon their own heads
tn.text: Here "blood" represents a person's death. To be responsible for their own death is spoken of as if their blood would be on their heads. AT: "their death will be their own fault" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
"we will be innocent"

tn.ref: if a hand is laid upon any
tn.text: Here "a hand is laid upon" is a polite way of referring to causing someone injury. AT: "if we cause injury to any" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
The two Israelite spies continue to speak to Rahab about their promise to her.
The spies required Rahab to remain silent about their visit or they would be free from their oath to protect her family.
"You" refers to Rahab. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_yousingular]])

tn.ref: May what you say be done
tn.text: Rahab agreed to their terms of the oath to protect her family.
The two Israelites spies leave Jericho.
"their pursuers returned to the city, to Jericho." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This refers to the men not finding the spies.
The two men returned back to the Israelite's camp. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: returned and crossed over and came back
tn.text: These are similar expressions referring to returning to where the Israelite's are camped. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])
"cross over" means to go to the opposite bank of the river. AT: "traveled from this side to the opposite side of the Jordan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This is a male name; the father of Joshua. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: everything that had happened to them
tn.text: "all that the men had experienced and seen."
This word, "us," refers to Israel.

tn.ref: inhabitants of the land are melting away
tn.text: The people of the land toward Israel are like a substance that melts in the presence of heat. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
